Reviews.Author: Kyle Brotherton
Reviews.Content: This is my first tablet, and I love it! I bought it largely to stream movies with Netflix (subscription required). Thanks to this tablet, I've also discovered free ebooks and magazines from my local library. I love reading my local newspaper in the free Overdrive app (newspaper subscription required). Checking email, weather reports, and my Hotmail calendar is quick and easy. I'm glad I got a 10" tablet because magazines, movies, and games can really take advantage of the extra large screen.Over all, I think this tablet is a great value. I would buy it again, and I highly recommend it. Keep in mind that installing a bunch of apps and customizing the tablet may require some extra know-how plus hours (and hours) of your time. I also recommend that you purchase an inexpensive tablet stand (there are several types available on Amazon).I'm probably going to also buy a Kindle e-reader. The e-ink screens are easier on the eyes; and dedicated e-readers are much easier to hold when you're reading a book for several hours.What I like:> Large, beautiful screen> Excellent touch response> Easy to use settings> Convenient buttons for power, volume, and "back"> Expandable storage via MicroSD slot> USB connection> Wifi was easy to set up and connect to my home network> Great built-in email client> Great battery life with most apps (several hours)What I dislike:> Cannot access Google Play (a.k.a. Android app store)> Front-facing camera is almost worthless. No flash, can't easily scan QR codes, doesn't work well with Skype app> Built-in speakers are not very loud. You may need to use headphones or an external speaker> Heavy and difficult to hold for long periods of time (like reading a book)> Web pages take a while to load. It's often faster to just turn on my laptop when looking something up> Cannot mount a network drive (or at least I can't figure out how to), although you CAN browse network drives using the included ES File Explorer app> Battery life is too short for reading lots of books (typical problem with color LCD tablets)> No back-facing camera> It takes a while to charge (I feel like it takes several hours, but I haven't timed it)What I use it for:*Note: Some of these apps were hard to find and/or install because this tablet cannot access the Google Play app store.> Watch movies with Netflix app - Netflix subscription required> Listen to music with Pandora app> Read local newspaper with PressReader app - newspaper subscription required> Read ebooks and magazines - borrowed from local library via website (free) - using Overdrive app and Kindle app for ebooks - Zinio app for magazines> Check my Hotmail calendar> Check the weather with Weather.com app (free)> Check email> Check my budget with YNAB app (requires YNAB desktop software)> Surf the web with Firefox app (free)Where I get my apps:> Amazon app store (lots of great free and paid apps)> Aptoide app store (some apps, hit or miss)> papktop.com (some apps, hit or miss)> Getjar (a few apps)> Bing search for the app's "apk" file, then transfer the apk file to tablet and install it> Other random app websites (often difficult to use, some may not be entirely legal)Update: I have been using this tablet for a few months. My rating has dropped to a "3". Netflix works alright, and so do email apps, magazine apps, weather app, Pandora, etc. Skype doesn't work at all. Web browsing is PAINFULLY slow, and pretty much pointless. Apps freeze all the time. The tablet can't even run the keyboard app smoothly. But the worst part is WiFi. It often loses the wireless connection when I take it more than 40 feet from my router. That is unacceptable. I'm going to sell it and buy a better tablet. Sometimes a good deal just isn't good after all.
Reviews.Title: Great Entry-level Tablet!

Reviews.Author: Sherri L. Palmer
Reviews.Content: I tracked this down, Coby went out of business and bought out by another company. In under 6 months of buying the tablet, it is unusable as the screen shows so much static you can't see what is being displayed.  I tried to get technical support from Coby, but when all emails were returned and the tech support line points to the website for answers, which there are none on the website.. i dug more, and found that the Better Business Bureau has a horrible rating for them, and with more digging I found they were bought out around Aug 2013.  I tracked down the new company and they claim no warranty or support on the previous companies products, Coby.  So this was a complete waste of money and the machine is useless.
Reviews.Title: Coby no longer in business, left with no technical support for any products

Reviews.Author: Donna
Reviews.Content: I ordered this as a Christmas gift for my mother.  It does not have google play but it was OK for her needs.  She liked it up until a week ago when it just stopped working and would not turn on.  I have tried to reach Coby several times but they do not return emails.  When you call their number listed in the manuel and on their website,  you get a recording instructing you to go to their website and then it hangs up on you.  Please beware,  I googled "coby complaints" and everyone listed the exact complaint that I have described here.
Reviews.Title: Don't waste your money

Reviews.Author: Sara Fabry
Reviews.Content: the tablet is OK.  the screen responsiveness is not that great. not supporting google play is kind of a pain but maybe not a deal-breaker. however, it seems that the company is more an issue than the actual tablet. i purchased this in april and after about 2wks of regular use it turned itself off and would not charge.  i was able to reset the tablet and did not loose any data. but about 2 months after that the screen turned white and the tablet stopped working.  i contacted customer service and was sent instructions via email.  now 8 weeks later customer service does not respond to methods listed on website (email) automated or otherwise and phone numbers are not answered with in listed business hours (the main customer service number instructs you to go to the website 3 times and hangs up on you). product was returned within warranty requirements and according to emailed instructions. however, it states that the product can be expected to be returned around 6-8 wks after the product reaches savannah, ga. however the product never was delivered through or to Georgia. it has now been 8 wks and I am unable to get a response from the company - phone or email.  i have now made a formal complaint through the BBB.  unfortunately a quick search turns up many other people that have had this problem.  spend the extra $50 or so and get something reputable and reliable.
Reviews.Title: spend the extra $50

INVESTIGATE the bastards.In addition, I have already filed complaints wit the Sate of Fl, Division of Consumer Services, and the BBB of Cal and FL.--------------------------------------------HERE IS MY ORIGINAL RETURN LETTER5 May, 2013Coby Electronics CorporationTechnical Support150 Knowlton WaySavannah, GA 31407912-966-2629RE: Return of Model# 620-8GBRed MP3 Player for Replacement.Coby TS:I have owned two Coby MP3 Players. My current is the 620 8GRED and while I enjoy it and it seems to come on, the head sets ALWAYS start distorting or just don't make contact.They just do not seed properly and I usually never get anything, let alone clear sound.I deleted all the personal music and stuff so it is empty.I have tried multiple brands of headsets and plugs (especially Coby) and it his cost me more than the players!! None of them work.Both players still don't work. I threw the 601 into the Atlantic out of frustration and bought the 620. Now it is doing  the same thing. Reviews.Title: COBY PRODUCTS, SUPPORT AND RETURNS...READ THIS and DO NOT BUY ANY COBY PRODUCT, EVER.

Reviews.Author: Joseph R. Moore
Reviews.Content: Google play is the best app store. Unfortunately the coby system does not accept it.  This would insure a fifth star. Other than that I love my tablet and would recmend it
Reviews.Title: If only it came with google play.

Reviews.Author: An Avid Reader
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a cheap tablet that I can use to study, read books, and take everywhere easily.  I read the other reviews before purchasing this tablet, and I noticed that everyone's complaint was the lack of apps on the tablet.  I rooted my tablet, installed ClockworkMod, a rom with Google Apps included, and after resetting the permissions, I was all set.  took less than 10 mins.  I have app the apps I want installed!!  The tablet itself is not heavy, responds to touch well, and has a great screen.  I would google rooting your Android device before purchasing this table to get full functionality.  It's no point if it's not rooted!
Reviews.Title: This is a great tablet for the price!

Reviews.Author: Scablo
Reviews.Content: Not a top of the line tablet, but a good starter tablet for my kids.  Display screen is crisp and clear.  Easy enough to use that my little one figured it all out fairly quickly even after only a little instruction.  Would like to give it 5-stars, but it does not work with Google Play and that is a pain. Their version of Google Play is available, but it just is lacking in the available apps so often the kids are upset.  A way around it is Amazon so you can try that, only need an Amazon account.
Reviews.Title: Good for the Cost

Reviews.Author: Tim
Reviews.Content: I like it because:It is surprisingly fast,it is VERY lightweight (being an 8" tablet it is MUCH lighter in weight than a 7"-SamsungTab2),it is THINNER THAN 7"SamsungTab2,it has a good wifi connection,it has a good battery life,it has a good vivid screen,it is a multi touch device (five fingers :)and, oh yeah, it is not expensive :)The only downsides are:1) no bluetooth (but it's ok for the price)2) camera is not 5 MP (but once again it's ok for the price)3) no access to the Google market (but it is not a problem for an experienced Android user, even without any rooting)
Reviews.Title: Fast, lightweight, thin, has wifi, good battery life but no bluetooth

Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: This is my first tablet so I can claim no real expertise.  The Coby Kryos MID7048-4 did however meet all my expectations.  My main reason for purchasing this tablet was in order to read E-Books.  I installed Kindle for Android and all works great.  I wasn’t sure that I would like reading on a tablet but soon found that I actually prefer it to paper books, not to mention the convenience of not having books stacked all over the place.  Amazon has tons of books available and if you have an Amazon Prime account many are free and many more are very inexpensive.  Browsing the net is expectedly not as convenient as on a full sized computer, but it is certainly a reasonable option when needed.  The screen resolution is quite good though I know more expensive tablets have higher resolutions.  There are tons of applications available from Amazon and the many other Android App. Stores. I have a 32gb Micro SD card installed which works great.  I also purchased a OTG (On The Go - Male Micro USB to Female Standard USB) cable and have accessed both 16 and 32gb USB flash drives. I have had a little trouble reading the flash drives a couple of times but suspect that it is more the cable than the tablet that is at fault.  I have ordered another, hopefully better, cable.  The touch screen works well with the exception of some difference in where you touch the screen and where it registers on the screen.  This seems to be mostly around the edges of the screen.  Once I turned on the option (in the system settings) that shows a blue dot where your touch is registering I soon learned how to compensate. There have been some minor glitches here and there, but nothing that was more than a minor issue and certainly nothing more than one might expect from ANY computer.I had intended to purchase a keyboard case for the tablet but decided that the screen keyboard worked well enough so as not to need one.  I did purchase a basic case made by Poetic. The first one did not fit properly even though it was said to be for the MID7048-4 as it covered up part of the RH side of the screen.  I returned it and ordered another case also made by Poetic which did fit well and which I am quite happy with.  That case is an ASIN: B00ANGOIR2 (product number).  If you are interested in a case do an Amazon search for B00ANGOIR2 and it should bring it up.  It did at the date of this review.One more thing, do not step on the tablet.  Mine slipped off of the bed and I did not realize it until the crunch.  LOL  Ok, so I didn’t laugh at the time, but I did order another Coby MID7048-4.to replace the unfortunate one.
Reviews.Title: For the price

Reviews.Author: S. Austin
Reviews.Content: I bought this tablet as a Christmas present for my tech-savvy six-year old nephew. He has dominated his Mom's IPad so I though it was time for him to get his own and the price was right. I opened it before giving it to him to set it up with games and educational software. Although the reviews for this tablet are mixed, it really depends on what you want to do with the tablet and how much you want to spend. The display is just okay with a resolution of 800x600 and it's a little dim for me. It has a front-facing 0.3 mega-pixel camera - okay for a child. The tablet runs Android 4.0, has 1Gb RAM and a 1GHz processor. It weights 24 ounces, has an HDMI port, a micro SD card slot for up to 32GB of storage and a built-in microphone and speaker. The speaker was just okay and I didn't test the microphone. You don't have access to Google Play but can download apps from Amazon (after you install the Amazon app package) and also some free apps are included in the GetJar app that is installed. The battery charges pretty quickly and WiFi works fine (we didn't see the problems that others noted.)  At a price of less of $120, this is good first table for children and even some adults. I own both an IPad and a Samsung Galaxy tablet primarily for software development purposes but I found this tablet okay for my nephew as a start.
Reviews.Title: Nice little tablet

Reviews.Author: CLS
Reviews.Content: It is limited in application. It cannot sync with google apps and therefore a callender account cannot be set and google apps cannot be downloaded. As a result you cannot set appointments and events.  It has only a front loading camera. This makes video recording akward. The pluses are the ereader, the games from getjar which the kids love and the skype app. Apart from these I would not recommend buying it.
Reviews.Title: Coby Kyros 7 inch Android Disappointment

Reviews.Author: Dena L. Headley "DNA"
Reviews.Content: NOT REALLY HAPPY WITH THIS PRODUCT BECAUSE IT DOES NOT HAVE THE GOOGLE PLAY STOREINSTALLED ON IT OR I CANT FIND IT SO I CANT GET APPS FOR THE ANDROID
Reviews.Title: NO GOOGLE PLAY STORE APP

Reviews.Author: Mayra Mendoza
Reviews.Content: After having bought this tablet, I am wishing I hadn't. I wish I had saved up the extra few hundred dollars (maybe less) and purchased a better quality tablet. It's good if you need a tablet for practicality. I am used to the Apple Store and Google Play, having owned both an iphone and an android. So, seeing only "GetJar" did not seem that bad. However, the app selection is wanting. I didn't think not having access to that many applications would bother me that much, but it's limiting. I can't even download my beloved Firefox :( It doesn't look good and doesn't have the button in the center. I didn't listen to the other reviews, but you should and spend a little bit more for a better quality tablet.
Reviews.Title: You get what you pay for

Reviews.Author: victor
Reviews.Content: The hardware is great, very fast, but doesn t include play store. This means apps in this tablet are not very good.
Reviews.Title: Not Play Store

Reviews.Author: Scarlette
Reviews.Content: So far I think I like it.  I am very green on this so I have more questions than answers.  I have downloaded several (aps) games but I don't see them when I go to the aps page.  Under favorites it is blank.  How do I connect with facebook?  I put in my e-mail address and password but it doesn't come up.  I did get e-mail to work and the internet.  If anyone can help me I would appreciate it.
Reviews.Title: new to tablets

Reviews.Author: That giiiirl "Navyboy78"
Reviews.Content: I after doing much research on Coby tablets decided in spite of the one star reviews on here to give it a shot. As other reviewers suggested after my package arrived next day,i  immediately downloaded Amazon store app. I did this by selecting Amazon store app apk. http://www.amazon.com/gp/mas/get/android. That is the link that takes u right to the download. It downloaded fast with no issues and from the Amazon store i downloaded Dolphin hd browser,Netflix (which this tablet does play and well not laggy at all. loads lil slower then id like but movie streaming is seamless.) Yahoo mail app,Aim app, Weather channel app and Angry Birds Space and other assorted apps such as games and Amazon Kindle app for downloading books.All Downloaded with no issues and work fine. This is a pretty good E reader as well. There is a one Second Delay when u switch from Landscape to Portrait view but nothing to complain about. It is flash 11 enabled so u can watch you tube videos it does come with the app already loaded and on your home page and it can play videos from sites like solarmovie.so. As far as Facebook games it can play some but not all. So games like Farmville u will need to get Farmville express since the app was discontinued for some reason for which u can find easily by googling it. The Battery life is a little short as others reviewers did say i get about 3 hrs of battery life before it needs to be charged. Standby time is good however lasting easily 10hrs in standby mode. The camera is ok it is front facing and only 0.3 mp but it does have zoom and can take videos. I downloaded skype and skyped with it and built in mic and Camera are ok not great but  people could see and hear me well. Just not recommended in bright areas it will wash out the camera. The built in web browser is decent but i added Dolphin had which i like better Opera Mini is also a good browser. You cannot get Google Play or app store out of box. You could root this tablet and other reviewers have suggested ways to get it to work i did not try them however. Amazon app store plus other various free ware sites Such as getjar freewarelovers.com etc provide a lot of free apps that work fine. Getjar site is working again not all apps will download but most do and are free.  The screen is clear and bright resolution is very good. It is not laggy at all as of yet and when u type it doesn't have that annoying delay from what u type till it appears in your text block. it types very smoothly. All and all it is a good tablet for the 97 bucks u pay for it. I will update this status if any issues arise after i had it for a couple weeks. The Battery life is Shorter then i would like that is my only complaint as of yet.
Reviews.Title: Great price for a good tablet!!

Reviews.Author: bmb8548
Reviews.Content: My son, who is 28 years old, loves this think.  He broke his, he is saying it is MUCH better than his last one.
Reviews.Title: GAVE TO MY SON

Reviews.Author: shirley  reese
Reviews.Content: Loved it and it was good for the price.Could not ask for more.I would buy another when the time comes.
Reviews.Title: Even Better

Reviews.Author: Ishk
Reviews.Content: My Coby Kyros 10" is 1.5 yrs old.  I have struggled with it from the get go as I could never figure out how to get Adobe flash on it.  It was very frustrating.Last week I read Amazon's reviews and learned how great the Amazon Store aps work with Androids since the arrival of the Kindle Fire.  So I cleared my Coby (look in the privacy tab) and started over.WOW what a difference!  I can now get everything I want: Netflix, Pandora, Skype, etc.Thanks to so many who talked about it here!
Reviews.Title: Amazon aps

Reviews.Author: Stephanie
Reviews.Content: If you don't need something with a lot of frills and speed then this is more than enough! I wanted something we could take with us on vacations and trips and not worry about lugging around a laptop that could easily break. This Coby Kryos does not feel cheap or flimsy, I was more than happy when it arrived. It is a bit slow on the internet, but no different than a 4G cell phone. The picture quality is also very nice!Also, it does have a USB port, I don't know why people say it doesn't. I just ordered one of the keyboard cases that you can prop up and turn the tablet into a laptop of sorts. The keyboard plugs in via the USB port.
Reviews.Title: Great tablet for the price!

Reviews.Author: Jordan McGuire
Reviews.Content: This tablet does all that I need in a tablet computer:-)  it has an ok benchmark rating using antutu .  It plays video really well plays 3d games with ease. Overall pretty good tablet, however I think gogle should rethink letting developers use android without having the licensed versin because most users want acces to goolee play and also other google software. If this tablet had googe play I would give five stars thank you
Reviews.Title: Good tablet for price

Reviews.Author: Eric Seebach
Reviews.Content: its a good size and cheap don't know what else you can expect out of a tablet this size and price. Does every thing my wife wants it to
Reviews.Title: ok tablet

Reviews.Author: Maria Quintana
Reviews.Content: I am pleased with the product, but the capacity of the internal memory is not what you say. when connected to the pc, says I have 2GB of memory, not 4GB. Like when I see the memory capacity on the tablet. says 2gb.  :S
Reviews.Title: Good

Reviews.Author: APR
Reviews.Content: 10.1 inch 16:9 version.The main bad reviews I saw was the lack of google play and multitasking. The lack of google play is true but it did not stop me from getting all the popular apps. Just search the web for the app you want plus the keyword "apk". Then download and install. Netflix works flawlessly as well as the youtube "official" app, pandora and others. I had them all working within a few hours.Also was able to put all my mp3 on a micro-SD and these play without any trouble.Multitasking: no trouble listening to music while browsing and using other apps.External keyboard works perfect and the tablet (the 16:9 one) has both a full size and micro usb host.For scientists: there is a VerbTex Latex editor that works very well with external keyboard and you can get Anoc app to do Octave (MATLAB) programming. With Connectbot, you can ssh into external servers and edit/run code so you can actually work on these tablets. However, you do need an internet (wifi) connection active for these apps but this is an app limitation so you will have the same issue on anything more expensive.
Reviews.Title: Quite good - no problems getting all apps working including netflix, pandora, etc

Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "aspiring author"
Reviews.Content: I like the tablet, however it is a little slow and I had some issues with my angry birds games, had to reinstall two versions of the game. otherwise, it's good. I have to be careful not to install to many apps, otherwise the whole system seems to slow down.
Reviews.Title: tablet review

Reviews.Author: sergio
Reviews.Content: Exelente el producto e igual la atencion!!!Es un equipo muy completo lo recomindo, sobre todo para los que gustan de juegos super divertido
Reviews.Title: Tablet

Reviews.Author: JR
Reviews.Content: Likes:  Very affordable tablet that is simple and easy.  Recommend it for those who are NOT power users or not so tech savvy.  I have a few games on it for entertainment (Word Search, Flow, etc) but mostly use it for reading books (comes with reader installed), work documents (downloaded the Adobe PDF reader from Amazon), checking email.  Really easy to move data/music on and off.  Like not having to mess with ITunes account.  We also bought the 9" model and like it just as well.Dislike:  camera is not very good.  Have had some difficulty getting a connection at certain wifi spots.  Also my son had othe same 10" model.  He tried to install some of the bigger games on it and it crashed.  After spending some time on the phone with Tech suport we had to send it back.  (by the way, Coby Tech Support were great!)  He had to end up going with the IPad to handle his gaming-the Android games he was downloading aren't always compatible with the tablet.
Reviews.Title: great tablet for the price

Reviews.Author: hmm
Reviews.Content: I got this for my daughter for Christmas. I was putting apps on it and it totally locked up. The power will not even shut off. She is going to be so disppointed.
Reviews.Title: Tore up in one day!

Reviews.Author: MA VICTORIA
Reviews.Content: coby works really good, not as fast as samsung galaxy.but for me its perfect for the price. i cant complain, i love it, honestly.
Reviews.Title: coby tablet is pretty good

Reviews.Author: Donald W. Perry Jr.
Reviews.Content: Everyone has an opinion I know, and I am no different.  But this tablet was a gift to my picky wife and she is over the moon with it.  Does everything she wants, big enough so she doesn't have to squint, and affordable enough to not break the bank.  Probably one of the best purchases off Amazon ever.  In fact, I am going to be buying one every month from now on to give to my employees.  Does that tell you how much I liked it ????
Reviews.Title: Great Tablet

Reviews.Author: Marcelo Chaves Garro.
Reviews.Content: El articulo llenó mis expectativas, llegó sumamente rapido y Estoy muy satisfecho con mi compra,  era igual al de la decripcion.
Reviews.Title: excelente!!!

Reviews.Author: Yvette Deschaine
Reviews.Content: I bought this as I travel to europe once a year and did not want to bother with my laptop...so far it works great, its harder to get free books for this one then it is for the kindle tho..
Reviews.Title: awesome

Reviews.Author: Just A Dad
Reviews.Content: You should know that the camera on this device is not for taking pictures. The camera is located on the same side as the display. It is designed for video conferencing application but not movies and pictures.That concern aside it is a great tablet for the money. It costs less than a Sony ereader and does four times as much.Four starts for confusing me about the camera.Here is an update: I have noticed that the corners are not as touch responsive as the middle. This is particularly frustrating on the Getjar appstore because the search function is up in the top corner. You still can't beat the value though.
Reviews.Title: Camera?

Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Coby Kyros you can surf the web, but to download music, videos and other applications its says, you do not have any applicatons, I assume when you pay that sort of money everything should come ready to go., not trying to figure out how to get the stuff loaded in order to have it functioning.But i do like it, however, I also thought that 10.1 would have been bigger, like a square and not oblong.
Reviews.Title: Coby Kyros you can surf the web, but to download music, videos and other applications its says, you do not have any applicatons,

Reviews.Author: Kaila Brewer
Reviews.Content: This tablet was my first tablet ever and i was so happy with it. I paid like 172 dollars for it at the time i ordered it but it was worth the money. I can say that the only things i did not like about this tablet was the fact that it does not support Google Play, YouTube videos were tremendously slow when loading, and the camera quality sucked. Since i got majority of my apps from the Amazon App Store, i was ok with not having Google Play. I never really use YouTube that much either so that was fine with me, and also i never used the camera so this tablet was just right for me. All and all, if you dnt mind not being able to use Google Play then i recommend this tablet for you, especially if you are on a budget and want a nice tablet to have. The games i had worked great and the screen quality is awesome. If you want to get a tablet for a child, this is even better because my 5 year old niece and 6 year old cousin LOVES this tablet and never wants to give it back to me :)
Reviews.Title: Good for a first time tablet

Reviews.Author: Blanca
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately I was looking to download skype and couldn't, I called them and they do not have the license for skype, so I had to return it... but I truly like it.  Skype was the feature I was hoping for the most.  But is a very good product really!!!...
Reviews.Title: I love it ...

Reviews.Author: Jim

Reviews.Title: EXc

Reviews.Author: George E. Stratton
Reviews.Content: 9-10-2012...I bought this to store and read technical PDF files that I use at my business and in the field every day. It's VERY good for viewing text documents and reading books. The quality seems good and the display is bright and fairly easy to read in the sunlight. The Browser is nice..it's tabbed for multiple page viewing. And having the 10 inch screen has it's advantages. I seldom have to zoom in to read something. I do have trouble viewing flash video in the browser...it just won't do it or I haven't figured it out yet. It does come with a You Tube viewer though and it works nicely. Of course it's being an Android system there are many apps that are fun and useful...you just can't download them from the Google store. Doesn't make sense to me...it's (Google) Android for pitty sake. It just says that it isn't an approved device. Thank goodness for Amazon's Appstore for Androids. You will find most anything you need there. It is a little thick and heavy as tablets go. It isn't an iPad for sure but it works for me...and at a great price, too.5-21-2013...After using it for a few months I have changed my rating from 4 to 1. It was OK as far as reading books and documents, and playing most apps. I had some problems with it though. It gets to where it takes 2 - 5 minutes to load a web page. I called Tech support (no problem getting through)and they told me to try a full reset. I hated to do that because it meant that I would have to re-install ALL of my apps but I did it anyway. It worked so I was happy with it for a short while until it started doing the same thing again. I called them back and they sent me a email explaining how to return it...to include the receipt and a $15.00 money order for return shipping. What really gets me is they state that it will be 6 to 8 weeks to process the claim...WHY SO LONG? It's been 3 full weeks since they received it so I just called and they told me that it still hasn't been entered into the system and that it will probably be a couple more weeks until it does. I'm sorry...that's just unacceptable. Well...I hope I get it back someday. In the mean time I bought a Samsung Galaxy 2 and am enjoying it immensely.8-14-2013...I wish there was a minus star that I could check. I will never buy another Coby device again. It has now been almost 4 months since I returned my tablet to Coby for warranty repair. I WAS able to contact customer care by phone...now even that is unavailable to anyone. You call the PUBLISHED phone number on their website and you get a recording telling you to go to cobyusa.com where the only option you have is to email them...so I did. I have emailed them twice asking them to simply return my tablet. After weeks I have yet to receive even a confirmation that they received my email. I wish I could understand how a company as successful as Coby is could deal with a customer in this manner.I must give Amazon some high praise here. I copied them the last email that I sent Coby. I got an email back from Amazon within hours of when I sent it apologizing for the problem that I have suffered with Coby. Not only that...they have refunded the entire amount that I purchased the tablet for, including tax and shipping. Amazon...you are a class act! I was unable to send return email to them thanking them but I can do that here...Thank you very much. I will defiantly continue buying from Amazon...just not anything Coby.
Reviews.Title: Seems very nice for the money...but read on...

Reviews.Author: Oilfield Trucker
Reviews.Content: For the money the quality of the item is self isn't bad, but it is not Google approved and any official Google app such as Google Play (Marketplace), maps, etc. will not work with it.  I even downloaded them and tried to run them.  The apps are specifically designed not to run on this device.  I spent a entire day doing research to root the device, but could not find any way to do this either.If you want a movie player or something for surfing the web, this device is fine for that and with the built in USB port, you can use a full sized keyboard or other devices easily.I would have given 4 stars had it been able to run the most popular apps in the world...

Reviews.Author: Jenni W Moore
Reviews.Content: I bought 2 of these tablets for my nephews for Christmas. As they are kids and I am their Aunt and not their Mom, I wanted to get a tablet that would give them everything they needed without costing an arm and a leg. I did research on these and thought this would be a good option. I was wrong. It does not come with Google Play. You have to root the device to add it. You can add Amazon Appstore pretty simply, but every time the tablets are turned off and back on the appstore as to be uninstalled/reinstalled to work. It comes with an app store called GetJar which online appears to have most of the apps they would want. However, many of these are not compatible with this tablet, including Angry Birds. I am returning these. I would rather spend a little more and get them something with more options.

Reviews.Author: Cloud "Wolf"
Reviews.Content: I bought this Coby Kyros Mid-7048-4 model last week. I was impressed the battery was fully charged when I took it out of the box. That was a thoughtful gesture from Amazon. No problems so far. Very fast connecting with Wi-fi and I already put it 18 movies (via 32gb micro sd) and worked well. It has some apps already installed (basics), but lots of possibilities to advance for more apps out there. I bought this mainly for email checking and watching movies. The battery lasted at least 6 hours of movie watching (surprisingly). The only cons is the resolution, 800 x 480.  This could have been a perfect tablet if the resolution is higher; but for a tablet priced less than $100 bucks, you can never go wrong. I compared this tablet for my Blackberry Playbook which I already own (purchased 2 months ago), this Coby Kyros Mid-7048-4 is faster and more RELIABLE than the Playbook. I only have my Playbook for 2 months and now having issues from it. I must say, not all expensive tablets out there, is really worth as they should. I am glad I bought this Coby Kryos Mid-7048. Highly recommended!!! Thanks Amazon for the excellent service! j,sandiego

Not very fast internet loses connection often and freezes often as well. Once games are downloaded the work 95% of the time but also freeze up time to time. My first tablet worked ok for about a month then just stopped charging and holding a charge amazon replaced it. The second one they sent me lasted about a week before little white lines began to run across the screen at random amazon replaced it again thankfully. I am now on #3 have had it about 2 weeks now finding the same problems I had in the beginning before the charging problems and same problems as on the second as far as being slow and freezing often. Not very impressed.
Reviews.Title: "Eehh"

Reviews.Author: K. Counts
Reviews.Content: This was a late Mother's Day present for me. I have wanted a tablet for a while but to me a table is a "want", in other words not needed if you have an Android phone and a PC. I couldn't ever justify buying one for myself so my wonderful Hubby did it for me!I got the tablet 2 days ago. I am not sure why other people can't download the apps that I have but here is what I did. I opened it up and charged it for a few mins. Then I connected it to my home WiFi with no problem. I d/l Dolphin browser, Amazon App Store, Netflix, and several other apps from amazon.I restarted the Tablet and checked Netflix to see if it worked and it did no problem. Kindle worked and all of the other apps worked. I noticed several reviews stating that Netflix and Kindle wouldn't work and I am not sure why they had problems.The only downfall I see is that the internet is slow and freezes a lot when browsing. I'm not sure if it is the tablet or my internet. I am thinking my router is going bad so that may be the problem. I am searching for a solution online and will update when I figure out which is which.No you can't have Google Play Store but Amazon App Store, 1Mobile, and GetJar are sufficient for me. I have Google Play on my EVO 4G but rarely use it as I prefer Amazon. Amazon also has the Free app of the day and I have gotten many high $$ apps for free from them. IMHO Google Play is overrated.My Man paid one hundred ninety-five dollars for this tablet and I think it was definitely worth it! I would recommend this to anyone wanting a reasonably priced tablet -  totally not worth $400+ for others when you can get this one.I have read you can root and add a Titanium Rom to these tablets to make them run smoother and process faster. I feel sure I will do this someday when I read enough about it to understand how to.

Reviews.Author: willi
Reviews.Content: Okay, I've had this little gem for about 5 days now. I was looking for a ten inch tab, but didn't have a lot of cash. I already have the Acer Iconia A-100, which is a great tablet. But i wanted a 10 incher. When i first got it, it ran fine but there was no Google App Store, bummer, So I got the Amazon App Store. everything was working fine but when I loaded Netflix it didn't work, the app loaded fine but the screen would just go blank. I called Coby Customer Service and they said it was a problems with Adobe flash not running right? Anyways, with Coby you actually get a live person however, you may not get one that knows anything. So i looked around on the internet and found that this is a problem with the tablet. I also found a solution. A tech advised to reboot the system and erase factory files. Here is the message ---- "Power the unit off (holding power buttom) and selecting Power off, then hold simultaneusly back button and on buttom 8 seconds,when the android icon appears press the back button, in the menu select wipe data/factory reset pressing home buttom and then press back buttom, in the next screen select "yes delete all user data" pressing back buttom, and in the next screen select "reboot system now" with the back buttom and wait. IT WORK FOR MY TABLET." ------After doing this download the Good e-Reader app store through Getjar. The Good e-Read app store has everything. Netflix now works great on my tablet. I was also able to down load pretty much every app the Google Play Store has. They even have the Google Play Store app. Anyways, after doing this my tablet runs smoother, seems to be faster and everything works. Took this tablet from a 3 to a 5 star. I now love this tablet. Oh, when doing this it will erase things (music, pics, videos) on the tablet but not on the SD Card.

Reviews.Author: AeroEngineer
Reviews.Content: I needed a replacement for my mint condition but frozen kobo touch ereader and was certainly not going to give that company my business again and after seeing the prices for limited e-ink readers versus full fledged tablets it's no contest. The major thing is that tablets need a lot more charging than e-ink readers do. I had an Android smartphone a while back before deciding it wasn't worth the monthly plan charges so the OS wasn't a problem. So the Coby Kyros seemed to fit the bill for my needs: it comes with Aldiko ebook reader already installed so I don't even need to be online to get my main use out of it. It's relatively cheap too. It's easy enough to plug into my PC, load up my music, ebooks and movies. I had no major issues with the software as I only wanted an ereader functionality everything else was bonus. There was some stutter here and there while reading books and it would not import some larger pdf file books with lots of pictures but this could be an Aldiko thing. I ran movies and music off my 32gb micro sd card as there's not much room for a lot of those type of files on this, no problems running any of that.I was able to put most of my epub library on there no problem. Aldiko was fairly easy to import my books into once I knew which folder to put them in so it would read the books. I found it to be great for epubs, not that great for pdf's. I particularly liked the feature where it switched the exposure on screen for night reading as it's much easier on the eyes and probably uses less energy since most of the screen is black other than the words. The 16:9 aspect ratio is not the best for holding this as a book for long periods of time I have to say. Also they put the power/vol buttons right where you hold one side of it when in portrait mode for reading, not the best thing but it's not a deal breaker either. It does seem to kick the heat out around there too as my hands got sweaty while reading.I can't comment on the internet part of this since I don't have wifi at home and never needed it while I owned this. The touch screen was pretty responsive. The micro USB port needs to be better positioned as it EASILY gets knocked out while plugged in. I also didn't see a "charging" symbol when it was plugged into the PC via USB so I'm not sure if it was charging that way or not, it did fine with the dedicated charger though.I received it from warehouse deals and it was supposed to be in like new condition. Well it was not, the plastic case had a crack down the back that was already half way down and so I returned this for a refund. Coby needs to either use harder plastics, metal or work on their structural design for this item. I went ahead and got another brand and model in the same price range as this one that also has an ereader app as well as has Google play store pre-installed. Pass on this and get a play store item that's designed to be more sturdy for not much more in price. I'm using an efun/walmart nextbook 7" for the same price brand new as this tablet is used and it's much more sturdy with 8gb of onboard storage and google play, much better.

Reviews.Author: Andrew F. Vrba
Reviews.Content: The 8-inch screen is just the right size for gaming, and its HDMI out allows you to use the tablet like a proper game console! Its reasonably fast for the money, and it has a decent battery life. However it has some issues. Because most apps won't allow you to install to an external SD card, you are STUCK with the meager 4gb of storage space. It has NO out of the box Google Play support. This can be remedied, but at the risk of possibly bricking your tablet. While it plays most of Glu Mobile's swankier games just fine, you won't be playing larger, beefier games, due to the limited specs and low storage space. So don't get this tablet if you're wanting to play the likes of NOVA 3 or the Modern Combat series on your big screen. Mine developed a glitch that kept disabling the internal storage, and eventually had to get a refund. That might not happen to everyone's, but buyer beware.So there you have it. It's not the best tablet out there, but if you want a mid-level gaming tablet, you could do much worse!

We were able to revive 2 of them but the 3rd is a $130 brick, returned promptly. A 4th had the white-screen thing briefly but seemed to recover itself after a long charge. However this one is practically unable to connect to wifi unless you are standing within arm's reach of the router. Forums I browsed seem to feature this complaint regularly.When working, the display is fine and the 'feel' of the device is otherwise deceptively good. However you have a high probability of wasting a trip back to UPS to send it back. **UPDATE** on the same day I wrote this, a second tablet went completely dead. So that makes 2 completely dead at under 1 week of use, 2 that had near-death experiences.

Reviews.Content: I rarely write reviews, but this item really took the cake. I purchase many items online, read a lot of reviews beforehand and try to make an informed judgement. I wasn't looking for anything fancy, just something to stream some music on and maybe browse the internet when bored. The wifi on this thing is horrible. At first I thought maybe it was where I was using it. I then brought out my laptop and got fine reception everywhere. You can't stream netflix, pandora, or even get the apps to load in any kind of fluid motion. It will work great for 20 minutes sometimes and then not at all for the next hour. I probably spent more time troubleshooting it than I did using it. It was a gift from my wife for xmas, and I told her to get me one with the biggest screen, but for the price it should at least be able to perform basic functions that a tablet should.

Reviews.Author: My2cents
Reviews.Content: We purchased this for our 5 year old son because his father was getting an iPad and we wanted him to be able to have his own tablet, so he wouldn't constantly be harassing my husband.  For about a week, we tried using the GetJar store that comes preloaded on the tablet. There simply aren't enough apps to make this very functional for a younger audience. We researched this problem and saw Android tablets almost always need jailbroken to be more useful.  My husband is tech savy and had no problems completing the process. Now that the google play store is available, it is much better.  The processor speed is great for what we need it. We made sure to be a microSD card for extra storage so we can load his movies onto it. It has been nice for our long car trips!  Well worth the $90 price point.

Reviews.Author: Glen E.
Reviews.Content: I just bought the 10 inch version of this product about a week ago. I hated it at first and I even filed for a return. On a second thought, I decided to research some helpful hints and forums. DON'T BOTHER TRYING TO FORCE GOOGLE PLAY ONTO THIS DEVICE. IT IS NOT NECESSARY. Simply use the tablet browser to go to the getjar app website and download the getjar app. When you get the getjar app, download the "good e-book reader" app. Another great appstore is called mobile 1 app store. Between the three of these appstores, you have access to almost all of the nicer apps that google play has. Mobile 1 appstore has probably the best selection for a google play alternative. Also, get rid of the default browser and get yourself dolphin browser. The default browser is so and crashes frequently, but the problem is solved simply by installing a different browser. Also, the amazon appstore will work on this tablet. Now that I have access to many googleplay apps, I love it.

Reviews.Author: Joseph J. Schultz "poetographer1967"
Reviews.Content: I ordered this because a co-worker purchased one and was very happy with his. The first one I ordered was DOA. The second one seemed fine, but after only a month the battery drains from 100% to shutdown after only 90 minutes on WiFi - sometimes not that long! It does not have the Google Play Store available unless you root it, which would be fine if that was known up front. The available browsers (native browser, Dolphin, Opera) are either terrible, or don't interact well with the product. One of the main reasons I got the tablet was ease of blogging, and the Blogger site doesn't run correctly on any of them. The display is... OK. There's this weird shadowing thing that goes on when the screen tilts even a little bit. I know this is a bargain tablet, but I expect it to at least do the things it is built for, and it doesn't even provide the basics reliably. The most disappointing electronics purchase I've ever made.

Reviews.Author: Ginger B. "Noire"
Reviews.Content: I received the device on a Friday afternoon. Up until Tuesday morning, it wouldn't connect to the wi-fi. Every other electronic equipment in my house works fine (and i have at least 3), but this tablet won't connect. It keeps saying "Out of range" when I'm sitting only 7 feet from the router.I called Coby on Tuesday morning, and was told to reset the device. It worked fine for about 2 minutes, then same problem started again. It won't connect to the wi-fi!I've only had it for 4 days, so i'm going to give it another 3 days before i send it back.The 9-inch form factor is perfect for me (thus the 2 stars), but the thing has to work!PS: They advertise it as being 1lb, put i put it on a scale, and it's actually 1.25 lbs.Will update soon...*Update 1: June 6, 2012 2-stars rating changed to 3So I returned the first unit to Amazon, and got a replacement. It took 1 hour and $50 for my ISP provider to make the tablet connect to the home wi-fi.Calling Coby customer care for over an hour did not resolve the issue.I had to pay $50 to my ISP provider for them to figure it out for me because the tablet is not their product.I also noticed that the tablet does not come with flash player already installed, so some websites do not work. I've downloaded a flash player from Getjar, yet still no success. I have to spend another half hour or so with their customer service today so they can tell me what to do.So overall this tablet cost me $250, which is 50 bucks way more than I was willing to pay for it. If you add in the over 2 days spent trying to get it to do the number one thing i bought it for (connect to internet), that irks.Depending on the wi-fi settings in your house or wherever you try to connect, this unit might not work. Whereby my old HP Touchpad connects everywhere, every time, without a hitch.**Update 2: June 11, 2012 - 3 stars rating changed to 2I finally found a flash player that works, but it only works with the native browser, not the Google chrome browser that i downloaded.I had to do my own research online to find the right Flash player, because Coby customer support was completely useless. The version that they suggested that i use didn't work, and they became very dismissive over the phone and rushed me off the phone when they saw that what they were suggesting wasn't working. Sad!So all and all, I will go from 3 stars rating to 2 stars because i shouldn't have gone through all that i went through to have this tablet do the No. 1 thing I bought for.It costs me overall $250, too much of my time and a lot of frustration.***Update 3: June 27, 2012 - 2 stars rating changed to 3; Would have given 3.5 if it was possible.Everything now works, except it's very slow. My small laptop with half the Ram of this tablet processes things faster. The tablet is very slow, no matter in what application I'm in, no matter how many applications are running at the same time. The sound is very low as well, so i use the headphones a lot.Not being able to use my Google calendar in it sucks big time! I removed the Google chrome browser and replaced it with Dolphin HD. Much better.So all and all, it took 3 weeks of troubleshooting, extensive internet search, hours over the phone with Coby CS, 2 returns and exchanges to have this thing work properly.If you plan to do anything other than basic internet surfing, you will get frustrated with this tablet if you don't have tons of patience.

Reviews.Author: Dolemite
Reviews.Content: Let me first start by saying that this device is terrible.  Ok, now here is why.1. It is running 4.03 without access to play store.  For some this is not an issue, but most people need apps.  When you hear of an app that you really want, be prepared to not be able to get it.  They give you an app store called get jar, which is a joke.  Get jar has no apps at all.  With some Androids you can manually load Play Store, but this device is locked down.  Impossible.2.  This device is locked down.  I could not even browse files on my own SD card, let alone play a movie or listen to music on my SD card.  When I tried to download a file browser from crap jar I could not find one, but then again I could not search for one.  Every search that actually managed to work came back with the same results.  If I searched for butter I would get angry birds, if I searched for word processor I would get angry birds.  Crap Jar3.  The screen has an issue.  When I would run searches on the web, it would erase what I entered in the search bar when I pressed the search button.  This happened on several different sites, which means that it is the browser or the tablet, and being as I cannot load a different browser I have to live with it.4.  The device is fast, but that is because there is nothing on it.Complete junk.Oh and you might want to carry around a pair of toe nail clippers to get the SD card in and out as regular human fingers just dont seem to cut it.Oh and the usb port is an off standard, so dont go thinking you can use any cables you already own.

Reviews.Author: Kellena
Reviews.Content: I am a student with no laptop and no smartphone.  I have been trying to save money for a tablet for a while, and then received an Amazon gift certificate for Christmas.  This was the only tablet that was completely covered by the gift certificate, and after much soul-searching I decided to "spend it all in one place" and go for it.  I am thrilled to be able to see my school's website and class power points on the go - however, it took a lot to get there.The touch screen and on screen keyboard are better than expected.  The wi-fi is intuitive and excellent.  The pre-installed web browser was not supported by my college's online program at all.  I tried installing Chrome (the suggested browser) - however, as noted in most other reviews, this tablet cannot access google play, and play is the only place to download chrome.  So I tried installing firefox from Mozilla's website - which redirected me to google play.  I searched the pre-installed app store - GetJar - however NOTHING I attempted to download from there would work, it would give me an error message.  So then I installed Amazon apps.  That got me *some* apps (many are not even available for download onto this tablet)... however, every time I exited out of Amazon apps and then tried to enter back into it, the appstore wouldn't load and would give me only a black screen and search bar that did nothing.  I worked around this by uninstalling and re-installing Amazon apps each time I wanted to use it, which was tedious.  Meanwhile, I still couldn't get a browser that worked on my school website.  So, all I could do was check my email and facebook, and view pictures from my sd card.  Definitely not worth $100.  A friend found a link to download firefox after some serious searching.  Once I installed firefox, I was able to connect to my school's website and view our online syllabi and power points, but each time a screen loads it still gives me an error message that I must click out of.  That raised this from two stars to three.  Finally, I found. on the Coby wesite, instructions on how to get GetJar to work (you have to access GetJar from the Coby website, not the widget that comes pre-installed).  However, the GetJar site ended up not being worth any of the hassle.  But, Pandora installed and works great.  I can read any office document, but need to pay $15 if I want to be able to CREATE anything, inlcuding any word documents.  Back down to two stars.  I ordered a keyboard/case, and then a usb-to-mini-usb adapter to make it work, and it hooked up instantly and worked with no problems, so that brought it back to three stars.  I am planning on trying the reset described in an earlier review and hoping that google play will then work - but I am not holding my breath.Another serious problem that I have not yet solved is its complete refusal to record sound.  It plays songs fine, but the camera (front facing only, so can really only be used for skyping and the like) is very poor quality, and will NOT record sound.  An email to Coby customer support has gone unanswered.  Apps that have high star ratings don't work either.  So no recording of class lectures with this baby!If you need the ability to compose word documents you will have to pay for an upgrade to the pre-installed office program at $15.  If you want to record sound it will cost you more - perhaps a microphone, or better yet a completely different gadget at $30 or more.  If you want to take pictures, again you will have to buy a different gadget - either a phone with a camera or a camera itself - this one has its camera facing the screen and is poor quality and zero flash.  But if you want to be able to surf the web and check your email on a screen larger than a phone, this one will do it.In summary, had I been able to afford a slightly more new-technology or bigger brand tablet, I would never give this tablet a second thought.  However, considering that if this tablet had not been available I wouldn't have one at all, it isn't all THAT bad.  Better than having none at all, but if you can afford a slightly higher quality brand, do so.
